learning_objectives.objective: Define Quantum Key Distribution (QKD) and list its core quantum principles (superposition, entanglement, Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle, No-Cloning Theorem).

Explain how QKD detects eavesdropping through quantum state disturbances and distinguish QKD from broader quantum cryptography (QKD focuses on secure key exchange; quantum cryptography includes post-quantum algorithms).
Describe the step-by-step process of the BB84 protocol, including basis choice, polarization encoding, sifting, error correction, and privacy amplification.
Compare QKD with classical key distribution methods like Diffie-Hellman, highlighting QKD's information-theoretic security against quantum threats (e.g., Shor's algorithm).
Assess the limitations of QKD implementations (e.g., distance constraints, side-channel attacks) and evaluate hybrid QKD-PKI systems for real-world quantum-resistant cryptography.
Design a basic QKD network integrating ITU-T Q.4160 standards for Quantum Key Distribution Networks (QKDNs), incorporating post-quantum cryptography synergies.
